When a job scheduled by Slurm starts, it needs to know certain things about how it was scheduled, etc. E.g., what is it's working directory, or what nodes were allocated for it. VTK (Visualization Toolkit) is an open-source software system for 3D computer graphics, image processing, and visualization. It provides a wide range of tools and algorithms for creating and interacting with visualizations of scientific data, making it a versatile platform for researchers, engineers, and developers in various disciplines.

VTune Profiler, also known as Intel VTune, is a performance profiling tool developed by Intel. It enables developers to optimize software performance on Intel architecture platforms by providing detailed insights into application behavior, identifying performance bottlenecks, and suggesting optimizations.
The Khronos Vulkan API is an explicit, low-overhead, cross-platform graphics and compute API.

Wannier90 is an open-source code (released under GPLv2) for generating maximally-localized Wannier functions and using them to compute advanced electronic properties of materials with high efficiency and accuracy.

Wayland is a protocol for a compositor to talk to its clients and a library for the reference implementation of that protocol. It serves as an alternative to the X Window System, providing a simpler and more efficient approach to handling graphical environments in Linux and Unix systems.

Wayland is an object oriented display protocol, which features request and events. Requests can be seen as method calls on certain objects, whereas events can be seen as signals of an object. This makes the Wayland protocol a perfect candidate for a C++ binding. The goal of this library is to create such a C++ binding for Wayland using the most modern C++ technology currently available, providing an easy to use C++ API to Wayland.

WebKitGTK+ is a full-featured port of the WebKit rendering engine, suitable for projects requiring any kind of web integration, from hybrid HTML/CSS applications to full-fledged web browsers. It offers WebKit's full functionality and is useful in a wide range of systems from desktop computers to embedded systems like phones, tablets, and televisions.
Weblogo is a web based application designed to make the generation of sequence logos as easy and painless as possible.

WebProxy is a tool or service that acts as an intermediary between a client and the internet to provide functionalities such as web content filtering, caching, and increased privacy and security. It can intercept and filter web requests, block access to certain sites, and improve network performance.

WESTPA (Weighted Ensemble Simulation Toolkit with Parallelization and Analysis) is a software package designed for performing weighted ensemble simulations in the field of computational chemistry and biophysics. It enables researchers to explore complex molecular processes by parallelizing simulations and analyzing a diverse range of system trajectories.

GNU Wget is a free software package for retrieving files using HTTP, HTTPS and FTP, the most widely-used Internet protocols. It is a non-interactive commandline tool, so it may easily be called from scripts, cron jobs, terminals without X-Windows support, etc.

Whatshap is a software for phasing genomic variants using DNA sequencing reads, also called read-based phasing or haplotype assembly. It is especially suitable for long reads, but works also well with short reads.

The WiggleTools package allows genomewide data files to be manipulated as numerical functions, equipped with all the standard functional analysis operators (sum, product, product by a scalar, comparators), and derived statistics (mean, median, variance, stddev, t-test, Wilcoxon's rank sum test, etc).
Winnowmap is a long-read mapping algorithm optimized for mapping ONT and PacBio reads to repetitive reference sequences.

WPE WebKit allows embedders to create simple and performant systems based on Web platform technologies. It is a WebKit port designed with flexibility and hardware acceleration in mind, leveraging common 3D graphics APIs for best performance.

The Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) Model represents a cutting-edge mesoscale system for numerical weather prediction, designed to serve both atmospheric research and practical forecasting needs. Description Source:https://www.mmm.ucar.edu/models/wrf
Wtdbg is a de novo sequence assembler for long noisy reads produced by PacBio or Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT).

wxWidgets is a C++ library that allows developers to create native applications with a single codebase that can run on various platforms, including Windows, macOS, and Linux. It provides a set of GUI widgets and tools for building desktop applications with a consistent look and feel across different operating systems.

X11, also known as the X Window System, is a windowing system software used in Unix-like operating systems to provide a graphical user interface. It defines a protocol for client-server communication to render graphics and manage windows, allowing applications to display graphical elements on the screen.

x264 is an open-source software library for encoding video streams into the H.264/MPEG-4 AVC format. It provides a highly efficient and high-quality encoding solution widely used in video compression, streaming, and multimedia applications. x264 offers advanced encoding parameters for optimizing compression and video quality.

x265 is an open-source HEVC (High Efficiency Video Coding) encoder that enables efficient video compression for high-quality, high-resolution video content. It provides advanced encoding features and optimizations for achieving significant bitrate reduction while maintaining visual quality, making it suitable for various multimedia applications.

XALT (XALT: Cross-Platform Application Launching Tool) is a software tool designed to track job and process information on High-Performance Computing (HPC) systems. It captures and logs job-specific metadata such as software usage, compiler options, resource consumption, and job dependencies to facilitate performance analysis and optimization.

xarray is a powerful Python library designed for handling multi-dimensional arrays and datasets. It provides labeled array data structures that simplify data manipulation, analysis, and visualization in scientific computing and data science applications. xarray is particularly useful for working with labeled, multi-dimensional data in climate science, geoscience, and other domains.

xclock is a simple graphical clock application in the X Window System, commonly found in Unix and Unix-like operating systems. It provides a basic analog or digital clock display on the desktop, allowing users to track time visually and customize the clock appearance.

Xerces is an open-source XML parser library developed by the Apache Software Foundation. It provides tools and APIs for parsing, validating, and manipulating XML documents, ensuring well-formedness and schema conformance for XML-based data processing applications.

XGBoost (Extreme Gradient Boosting) is a scalable and optimized machine learning library known for its speed and performance in gradient boosting algorithms. It is widely used for regression, classification, and ranking tasks, providing high accuracy and efficiency in predictive modeling.
VisiData is an interactive multitool for tabular data.

XML-LibXML is an interface to libxml2, providing XML and HTML parsers with DOM, SAX and XMLReader interfaces, a large subset of DOM Layer 3 interface and a XML::XPath-like interface to XPath API of libxml2.

X.Org, also known as X Server, is an open-source implementation of the X Window System that provides the framework for graphical user interfaces in Unix-like operating systems. It serves as the display server handling user input, window management, and graphics rendering for X applications, enabling graphical desktop environments to function.

XPMEM (Cross-Page Memory) is a Linux kernel module that provides shared memory functionality for inter-process communication by allowing multiple processes to access a shared memory region. XPMEM facilitates efficient data exchange and communication between processes with reduced overhead and latency.

xprop is a utility in the X Window System that allows users to retrieve and display properties of X windows. It provides a way to query various attributes of application windows, such as window title, class, size, position, and other metadata, aiding in window management and debugging tasks.

Xvfb (X Virtual Frame Buffer) is a virtual X server that provides a virtual display framebuffer for running GUI applications without a physical display on Unix-like systems. It allows users to perform graphical operations in headless environments and is commonly used for automated testing and server-side applications.

xxd is a command-line utility that is part of the Vim text editor package and is used for creating or examining binary, hexadecimal, and octal dumps of files or text input. xxd provides a convenient way to analyze file contents, extract binary data, and convert between different data representations.

XZ is an open-source data compression utility that uses the LZMA (Lempel-Ziv-Markov chain algorithm) compression algorithm. It is commonly used to compress files and reduce their size while maintaining high compression ratios and providing options for efficient data archiving and distribution.

YACS (Yet Another Configuration System) is a lightweight, Python-based configuration management system used for handling configuration files and settings in applications. It provides a simple and structured way to manage and access configuration parameters in Python projects.

YAML (YAML Ain't Markup Language) is a human-readable data serialization format that is commonly used for configuration files, data exchange, and structured data representation. It aims to be easily readable by humans and supports various data structures and nested data hierarchies, making it a popular choice for configuration management and data storage.

Yasm is a modular assembler tool that supports multiple instruction sets and output file formats. It is designed for compiling and assembling codes into object files, providing flexibility and customization options for optimizing assembly language programming.

Z3 is a high-performance theorem prover developed by Microsoft Research that is used for solving satisfiability modulo theories (SMT) problems. It provides capabilities for automated reasoning and constraint solving in various domains such as software verification, automated planning, and formal methods.

Zarr is a Python library and file format for storing and managing large, multidimensional arrays efficiently. It provides a flexible and scalable way to store array data in chunks, enabling high-performance data access, compression, and parallel I/O. Zarr is well-suited for handling multi-dimensional array data in scientific computing and data analysis.

ZeroMQ is a lightweight messaging library that enables distributed messaging and communication between applications. It provides building blocks for creating fast and scalable message-based systems, supporting various messaging patterns like message queuing, publish-subscribe, and request-reply.

Zip is a popular utility for compressing and archiving files and directories into a single zip file. It provides a convenient way to reduce file sizes, organize data for storage or transmission, and create compressed archives that can be easily shared and extracted.

zlib is a software library for data compression and decompression using the DEFLATE data compression algorithm. It offers a fast and efficient compression method for reducing file sizes and conserving storage space. zlib is widely used in various applications for compression and decompression of data streams and files.

Zoltan is a library for parallel and distributed graph and mesh partitioning, ordering, and dynamic load balancing. It provides scalable algorithms and tools for optimizing the distribution of work in parallel computing environments, improving performance and efficiency.

Zsh (Z Shell) is an advanced and powerful shell for Unix-like operating systems, serving as an interactive command interpreter and scripting language. It offers extensive customization options, intelligent tab completion, and versatile scripting capabilities, making it popular among power users and developers.

zstd (Zstandard) is a high-performance data compression library and command-line tool that offers fast compression and decompression speeds with the ability to achieve high compression ratios. It is designed to balance efficient compression and decompression with speed, making it suitable for various data processing and storage applications.
